channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pavement near, 23rd September
item.description:
Graffiti advertising Fitness First has appeared spraypainted up and down both pavements on Salusbury near the gym . It is offensive, distracting, unsightly and a public nuisance.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street-wide bin theft, 23rd September
item.description:
Hello, Barretts grove appears to have a problem with our council bins, black and brown being stolen. We are in a street group chat and many of us have had our bins stolen we think between Friday and today.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barretts Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bath at junction of Glenarm and Lower Clapton, 23rd September
item.description:
The fly tipping has got slightly better at this spot after a problem running on many years so it would be great to fix this quickly to stop it getting worse again. Thanks!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenarm Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on Lyndhurst Avenue, 23rd September
item.description:
Hello. I would like to report fly tipping and loose rubbish on Lyndhurst Avenue. This problem has been going on for so long and we cannot see any long term solutions by council. This affects our neighbourhood and property valuations. This is right outside Kings Barber shop and this road is very dirty and messy all the time. Council should take more strict measures to stop this nonsense. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Lyndhurst Avenue, Friern Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree issue, 23rd September
item.description:
Could this tree be removed while Sandy lane is closed to traffic?? It is on the council verge and makes the road narrow
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Lane, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Speed humps marking not visible at night, 23rd September
item.description:
The speed bumps along this road need re marking so they are visible day and night. From the Road marking guide it states 4. Visibility and Conspicuity In darkness and adverse weather, road markings provide the primary visual guide. Visibility depends on: Line width Contrast with the road surface Retroreflectivity (especially at night) Environmental factors (e.g. glare, rain, worn surfaces) A minimum of two secondsâ€™ preview time is recommended for safe driver reaction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lighting above advertising board hanging off wall., 23rd September
item.description:
From Network Rail: Member of the public advises that he manages a venue next to Old Street Bridge, and there is a floodlight hanging off, some exposed wires and pigeon wire spikes hanging down at about head height causing a dangerous obstruction to the public from the arch under the bridge. He has just watched 3 people walk into it. Bridge plate: BR 455 - Old Street Bridge. Post code: EC1V 9LT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Street, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This is a constant problem. Rubbish dumped. Itâ€™s a health and safety hazard as sometimes there are dirty nappies or food and it attracts foxes and mice. There is a blind gentleman living in this street who can easily trip over these. This needs to be fixed soon.

item.title: Exposed electrical cable, 23rd September
item.description:
